summary: This document is an email chain from June 2019 discussing coordination between the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case. It mentions a meeting with an FBI Supervisory Special Agent (C-20's SSA) about exploitation and trafficking cases, and notes that staffing up for the Epstein investigation is underway.

persons.name: C-20
persons.context: Mentioned as the FBI SSA with whom the email sender and their team (GC chiefs, HT coordinators) met to discuss cases, including the Epstein investigation. The meeting is described as positive.

events.title: Meeting with FBI SSA C-20
events.description: A meeting occurred between the email sender (and their team of GC chiefs and HT coordinators) and FBI Supervisory Special Agent C-20 to introduce themselves and discuss exploitation and trafficking cases. The meeting was described as a 'lovefest' and very positive.

events.title: Planned meeting regarding USAO agent issue
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for the following day (June 20, 2019) to discuss a 'USAO agent issue,' though the email clarifies the primary purpose of the communication is about Epstein.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza (address of the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The email chain is focused on coordination for the Jeffrey Epstein investigation between the FBI and the SDNY USAO.
A meeting with FBI Supervisory Special Agent C-20 about exploitation and trafficking cases is described as very positive.
Staffing up for the Epstein investigation is noted as being underway.
The email clarifies that the communication is 'actually about Epstein,' not a separate 'agent issue.'
The correspondence shows internal DOJ/FBI coordination on the case in June 2019, prior to Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
